# Discussion

If you want to do LaTeX in line, like this, $10M_\odot$ use \$.

We can also add equations,

```{=tex}
\begin{align}
f = ma
\end{align}
```
We can also combine table styles. First, a \LaTeX table,
```{=tex}
\begin{table}
%\begin{table}[h!]
    \centering
    \caption{Our \LaTeX Table}
    \begin{tabular}{c c c}
        \hline
        Date & Time & Word \\
        \hline
        3/23 & 1700 & Foo \\
        3/24 & 0900 & Bar \\
        \hline
    \end{tabular}
\end{table}
```
then a Markdown table,

| Date | Time | Word |
|:----:|:----:|:----:|
| 3/23 | 1700 | Foo  |
| 3/23 | 0900 | Bar  |
: Our Markdown Table.
